snippet: To many Republicans and some scholars, President Obama’s decision to sidestep Senate confirmation for several appointees risked ending the Senate’s right to give advice and consent.
abstract: Many Republicans and some scholars criticize Pres Obama’s decision to sidestep Senate confirmation for several recent appointees, saying tactic risks ending the Senate’s right to give advice and consent.
lead_paragraph: To many Republicans and some scholars, President Obama’s decision to sidestep Senate confirmation for several appointees risked ending the Senate’s right to give advice and consent.

headline.main: Appointments Challenge Senate Role, Experts Say
